Description: Body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery vessel; exterior: black-figure decoration consisting of two male figures to right, possibly an athletic scene (from left, part of himation and one foot of first figure holding a spear or staff; part of naked legs of second figure); below, narrow black band above glazed area.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Fairbanks 1928 / Early Vases preceding Athenian Black Figure Ware (p. 127, pl. XXXVIII, no. 353.5)
Robinson 1893 / Catalogue of Greek, Etruscan and Roman Vases (p. 232, no. 178)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1999)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: P.4761 (Pottery & Porcelain Ledger No.)
